str2: Or prolonged paristano from para and histemi; to stand beside, i.e. to exhibit, proffer, recommend, substantiate; or to be at hand, aid.
From ktaomai; property, i.e. a domestic animal.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To place upon (a horse, mule). From epi and a reduplicated derivative of the base of basis; to cause to mount.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From dia and sozo; to save thoroughly, i.e. to cure, preserve, rescue, etc.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
From hegeomai; a leader, i.e. Chief person of a province.
Of Latin origin; happy; Phelix, a Roman.
